description.narrative: Output 31 An additional 500,000 people in 5 most deprived regions practice handwashing with soap/ash,which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 009 : 54% of population have sustainable and equitable access to and use of basic sanitation services underpinned by improved hygiene practices and sustainable water services by 2016.

mailing-address.narrative: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

sector.narrative: Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 31 An additional 500,000 people in 5 most deprived regions practice handwashing with soap/ash

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the government to demonstrate scaling-up of Handwashing With Soap (HWWS) as part of complementary sanitation and HWWS behaviour change programme, resulting in over 160,000 people practicing HWWS. This was supported by a school tippy-tap programme that achieved 95 per cent in the Volta Region (over 500,000 schoolchildren). | Status:Met | As-of Date:21/12/2017

title.narrative: Population practising handwashing with soap/ash as a result of UNICEF interventions
Health centres (clinics, hospitals, etc.) equipped with WASH facilities in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
80% of Schools in Volta Region have handwashing facilities
